foreignData.name: Wolpertinger
foreignData.text:
Kann fliegen.
Vernichte am Ende eines Kampfes alle Kreaturen, die einen Wolpertinger geblockt haben oder von ihm geblockt wurden.

mainBoard.name: Cockatrice
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Any non-wall creature blocking Cockatrice is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Cockatrice. Creatures destroyed in this way deal their damage before dying.

rulings.text: The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

mainBoard.flavorText: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.
mainBoard.name: Craw Wurm

mainBoard.flavorText: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.
mainBoard.name: Crumble
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target artifact; artifact creatures may not regenerate. Artifact's controller gains life points equal to target artifact's casting cost.

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its mana value.

mainBoard.name: Forest
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.name: Forest
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.name: Forest
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool.

foreignData.name: Erwachen der Wälder
foreignData.text: Alle Wälder werden zu grünen 1/1 Kreaturen. Sie zählen immer noch als Länder, und Du kannst sie für Mana tappen - allerdings nicht in dem Zug, in dem sie ins Spiel kommen.

mainBoard.name: Living Lands
mainBoard.originalText: Treat all forests in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

mainBoard.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

mainBoard.flavorText: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.

foreignData.name: Llanowarelfen
foreignData.text:
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um G.
Spiele diese Eigenschaft wie einen Unterbrechungszauber.

mainBoard.name: Llanowar Elves
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

foreignData.name: Köder
foreignData.text: Alle Kreaturen, die die verzauberte Kreatur blocken können, müssen dies tun. Köder verhindert nicht, dass Kreaturen, die die Eigenschaft haben, mehrere Kreaturen zu blocken, dies auch tun. Wenn der Blocker gezwungen ist, mehr Kreaturen zu blocken, als ihn möglich ist, darf der Verteidiger sich aussuchen, welche der Kreaturen geblockt wird, doch müssen so viele Kreaturen wie erlaubt geblockt werden.

mainBoard.name: Lure
mainBoard.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. If a creature has the ability to block more than one creature, Lure does not prevent this. If there is more than one attacking creature with Lure, defender may choose which of them each defending creature blocks.

rulings.text: As blockers are declared, any creature that’s tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can’t block doesn’t block. If there’s a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn’t block if that cost isn’t paid.
Lure doesn’t give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

foreignData.name: Regeneration
foreignData.text: {G}: Regeneriere die durch diesen Zauber verzauberte Kreatur.

mainBoard.name: Regeneration
mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, instead tap it, remove it from combat, and heal all damage on it.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.
mainBoard.name: Sandstorm
mainBoard.text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

foreignData.name: Lebensquelle
foreignData.text: Du oder ein anderer Spieler Deiner Wahl erhält X Lebenspunkte dazu.

mainBoard.flavorText: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

foreignData.name: Buschbasilisk
foreignData.text: Vernichte am Ende eines Kampfes alle Kreaturen, die den Basilisken geblockt haben oder von ihm geblockt worden.

mainBoard.name: Thicket Basilisk
mainBoard.originalText: Any non-wall creature blocking Basilisk is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Basilisk. Creatures destroyed this way deal their damage before dying.

rulings.text: Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk’s ability because the ability is not targeted.

The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

mainBoard.text: Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

mainBoard.name: Untamed Wilds
mainBoard.originalText: Search your library for any one basic land and put it into play. This does not count towards your one land per turn limit. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

mainBoard.flavorText: "What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf." —Conrad Aiken
mainBoard.name: Wall of Brambles
mainBoard.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate this creature.

sideBoard.flavorText: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.
sideBoard.name: Giant Spider
sideBoard.originalText: Does not fly, but can block flying creatures.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

sideBoard.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
